verses.kjv: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us, what work thou didst in their days, in the times of old.
verses.ct: God, we've heard it ourselves — our ancestors told us about everything you did in their time, in those ancient days.

verses.kjv: How thou didst drive out the heathen with thy hand, and plantedst them; how thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.
verses.ct: You drove out the nations with your own hand and planted our people there instead; you crushed those peoples and forced them out.

verses.kjv: For they got not the land in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them: but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou hadst a favour unto them.
verses.ct: It wasn't their own swords that won them the land, and it wasn't their own strength that saved them. It was your powerful hand, your strong arm, and your favorable presence, because you loved them.

verses.kjv: Thou art my King, O God: command deliverances for Jacob.
verses.ct: You are my King, God — decree victories for Jacob.

verses.kjv: Through thee will we push down our enemies: through thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us.
verses.ct: With your help we will push back our enemies; in your name we will trample those who come against us.

verses.kjv: For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.
verses.ct: I don't put my confidence in my bow, and my sword won't be what rescues me.

verses.kjv: But thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to shame that hated us.
verses.ct: No, you are the one who has saved us from our enemies and humiliated those who hate us.

verses.kjv: In God we boast all the day long, and praise thy name for ever. Selah.
verses.ct: We praise God all day long, and we will thank your name forever. Selah.

verses.kjv: But thou hast cast off, and put us to shame; and goest not forth with our armies.
verses.ct: But now you have rejected us and disgraced us; you no longer march out with our armies.

verses.kjv: Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy: and they which hate us spoil for themselves.
verses.ct: You make us retreat from the enemy, and those who hate us plunder us at will.

verses.kjv: Thou hast given us like sheep appointed for meat; and hast scattered us among the heathen.
verses.ct: You have handed us over like sheep meant for slaughter and scattered us among the nations.

verses.kjv: Thou sellest thy people for nought, and dost not increase thy wealth by their price.
verses.ct: You sold your people for nothing — you gained no profit from the deal.

verses.kjv: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.
verses.ct: You have made us an object of ridicule to our neighbors, mocked and laughed at by everyone around us.

verses.kjv: Thou makest us a byword among the heathen, a shaking of the head among the people.
verses.ct: You have made us a joke among the nations; people shake their heads at us in contempt.

verses.kjv: My confusion is continually before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,
verses.ct: My disgrace is constantly in front of me, and shame covers my face,

verses.kjv: For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and avenger.
verses.ct: because of the taunts and insults of those who mock and curse, because of the enemy bent on revenge.

verses.kjv: All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.
verses.ct: All of this has happened to us, yet we have not forgotten you, and we have not broken your covenant.

verses.kjv: Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy way;
verses.ct: Our hearts have not turned away from you, and our feet have not wandered from your path,

verses.kjv: Though thou hast sore broken us in the place of dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death.
verses.ct: even though you crushed us in a desolate wasteland and covered us in deep darkness.

verses.kjv: If we have forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to a strange god;
verses.ct: If we had forgotten the name of our God or reached out our hands to a foreign god,

verses.kjv: Shall not God search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.
verses.ct: wouldn't God discover it? After all, he knows the hidden thoughts of every heart.

verses.kjv: Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
verses.ct: Yet because of you, we face death all day long; we are treated like sheep lined up for slaughter.

verses.kjv: Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord? arise, cast us not off for ever.
verses.ct: Wake up, Lord! Why are you sleeping? Get up! Don't reject us forever.

verses.kjv: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?
verses.ct: Why do you withdraw your favor from us and ignore our suffering and oppression?

verses.kjv: For our soul is bowed down to the dust: our belly cleaveth unto the earth.
verses.ct: Our souls are pressed down into the dust; our bodies are flat against the ground.

verses.kjv: Arise for our help, and redeem us for thy mercies’ sake.
verses.ct: Rise up and help us! Rescue us because of your mercy.
